result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tavin Tenzell Stratton

records.addlTxt: Received and filed: Justice Point VIOLATION Supervision Report.

Defendant Tavin Tenzell Stratton in court.  
Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Tavin Tenzell Stratton.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. 
 Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and  he/she may not vote in any election until his her civil rights are restored. 
Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample nd advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 
Case is adjourned for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:30 am.
1347 WIS JI - Criminal
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
Received and filed: Justice Point STATUS Report.

Justice Point Violation ( Positive Drug Test) Report. 
Per Court parties contacted via email to address the violation.

Defendant Tavin Tenzell Stratton in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Tavin Tenzell Stratton.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. Defense requested plea hearing date; defense to file sentencing memorandum. Jury trial to remain calendared for October 17, 2022 at 9:00 am. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19. Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed: State's Witness List.
Received and Filed: Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Tavin Tenzell Stratton in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia. Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Wiliam R. F. Ackell.

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Discussions placed on the record. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.6.2022
Preliminary Questionnare and Waiver Form for Defendant, Filed.

Defendant Tavin Tenzell Stratton in court, appear in person with attorney Michael J Cerniglia, appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-25-2022, Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Tavin Tenzell Stratton in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Tavin Tenzell Stratton in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tavin Tenzell Stratton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
